dmca.title: EV1-C1550122I] Copyright Infringement - Piano on the Net
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.ev1servers.net/About/dmca.aspx

Legal Response Team

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net]

Conversation: [EV1-C1550122I] Copyright Infringement - Piano on the Net
Subject: [EV1-C1550122I] Copyright Infringement - Piano on the Net

MIME element (text/plain)
Dear Everyones Internet, Robert Marsh, Roy Marsh III, and Randy
Williams, 
 
One of your hosting-account customers, 
 
Swami Rajesh Chopra (Domain: www.liveindia.com - IP Address:
66.98.156.58), 
 
has stolen almost an entire website's content and republished it on your
server. 
 
Beginning on his page: 
 
http://www.liveindia.com/piano/index.html 
 
He has stolen the content (beginning) from: 
 
http://www.pianonanny.com/1.html 
 
If you page through his content, and then page through the Piano on the
Net content, you will see that he has stolen almost the entire website
known as PianoNanny.com's --Piano on the Net.  Piano on the Net is
located at: 
http://www.pianonanny.com/ 
 
Piano on the Net has won many awards and has been featured on the NBC
Nightly News (June 1998), CNN (October 1997), and in WebMaster (now CIO)
Magazine (August 1997). 
 
I have tried to contact him several times, but he refuses to answer. 
 
Since he is hosting this stolen content on your servers, I was hoping
you would be able to contact him and talk to him about removing it from
your servers. 
 
Your help in this matter would be greatly appreciated. 
 
I thought a "Swami" was supposed to be a holy man? I guess you don't
have to be an honest holy man if you're from India. 
 
Thank you. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
Clint Clark
Author and owner of Piano on the Net 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Clint Clark 
 
Web Designer /Consultant
The Art Department
www.pianonanny.com/portfolio/
clint.clark.email@gmail.com
(319) 504-2932
